channel.title: Go on Sanjay's Blog
channel.description: Recent content in Go on Sanjay's Blog

item.title: WebHook Tester
item.description: What is a webhook? A webhook is an HTTP POST request that is made when a change or event happens in a system. For example, this could occur when the system starts, stops, or when certain conditions are met. This HTTP POST request contains information regarding the change, which programmers can use to initiate actions. Consider GitHub as an example. When a push event occurs (which is a webhook event), GitHub sends a POST request to the payload URL.

item.title: learn go with tests
item.description: Part 1: Introduction This is an article about my experience completing “Go with Tests.” I wanted to learn a back-end programming language for web development, so after completing CS50, I first got started with web development from The Odin Project. However, I only did a few lessons and wasn’t very consistent. Additionally, I felt like every three out of five engineering college students were learning the MERN tech stack, so I wanted to do something different.
